sources.title: Six Gun Justice (1935) BILL CODY
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Cody, Wally Wales, Donald Reed
Director: Harry L. Fraser

Both Marshal McDonald and Nevada Joe and his gang are after money stolen by the Slades. When McDonald rescues Jim Slade from Nevada's gang, he is seriously wounded. Jim gets him to a doctor, and just as he returns to full strength, Nevada and his gang arrive, and Jim and the Marshal must face them.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Both Marshal McDonald and Nevada Joe and his gang are after money stolen by the Slades. When McDonald rescues Jim Slade from Nevada's gang, he is seriously wounded. Jim gets him to a doctor and just as he returns to full strength, Nevada and his gang arrive and Jim and the Marshal must face them.
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Donald Reed, Hal Taliaferro
